          • Field Detail

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Component( role = org.apache.maven.artifact.resolver.ArtifactResolver.class ) public org.apache.maven.artifact.resolver.ArtifactResolver artifactResolver

              Artifact resolver, needed to download the coreplugin jar.

              required:
              @readonly

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "${project.build.outputDirectory}", required = true ) public java.io.File classFilesDirectory

              Directory containing the class files for FindBugs to analyze.

              required:

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "${project.compileSourceRoots}", required = true, readonly = true ) public java.util.List compileSourceRoots

              The directories containing the sources to be compiled.

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "false", property="findbugs.debug" ) public java.lang.Boolean debug

              turn on Findbugs debugging

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "Default", property="findbugs.effort" ) public java.lang.String effort

              Effort of the bug finders. Valid values are Min, Default and Max.

              Since:
              1.0-beta-1

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.excludeBugsFile" ) public java.lang.String excludeBugsFile

              File names of the baseline files. Bugs found in the baseline files won't be reported.

              Potential values are a filesystem path, a URL, or a classpath resource.

              This parameter is resolved as resource, URL, then file. If successfully resolved, the contents of the configuration is copied into the ${project.build.directory} directory before being passed to Findbugs as a filter file.

              This is a comma-delimited list.
              Since:
              2.4.1

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.excludeFilterFile" ) public java.lang.String excludeFilterFile

              File name of the exclude filter. Bugs matching the filters are not reported.

              Potential values are a filesystem path, a URL, or a classpath resource.

              This parameter is resolved as resource, URL, then file. If successfully resolved, the contents of the configuration is copied into the ${project.build.directory} directory before being passed to Findbugs as a filter file.

              Since:
              1.0-beta-1

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="component.org.apache.maven.artifact.factory.ArtifactFactory", required = true, readonly = true ) public org.apache.maven.artifact.factory.ArtifactFactory factory

              Used to look up Artifacts in the remote repository.

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.failOnError", defaultValue = "true" ) public boolean failOnError

              Fail the build on an error.

              Since:
              2.0

            • @java.lang.Deprecated @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "true" ) public boolean findbugsXmlOutput

              This has been deprecated and is on by default.

              Since:
              1.2.0

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "${project.build.directory}", required = true ) public java.io.File findbugsXmlOutputDirectory

              Specifies the directory where the findbugs native xml output will be generated.

              Since:
              1.2.0

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.fork", defaultValue = "true" ) public boolean fork

              Fork a VM for FindBugs analysis. This will allow you to set timeouts and heap size

              Since:
              2.3.2

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.includeFilterFile" ) public java.lang.String includeFilterFile

              File name of the include filter. Only bugs in matching the filters are reported.

              Potential values are a filesystem path, a URL, or a classpath resource.

              This parameter is resolved as resource, URL, then file. If successfully resolved, the contents of the configuration is copied into the ${project.build.directory} directory before being passed to Findbugs as a filter file.

              Since:
              1.0-beta-1

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "false", property="findbugs.includeTests" ) public boolean includeTests

              Run Findbugs on the tests.

              Since:
              2.0

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.jvmArgs" ) public java.lang.String jvmArgs

              the arguments to pass to the forked VM (ignored if fork is disabled).

              Since:
              2.4.1

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="localRepository", required = true, readonly = true ) public org.apache.maven.artifact.repository.ArtifactRepository localRepository

              The local repository, needed to download the coreplugin jar.

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.maxHeap", defaultValue = "512" ) public int maxHeap

              Maximum Java heap size in megabytes (default=512). This only works if the fork parameter is set true.

              Since:
              2.2

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.maxRank" ) public int maxRank

              Maximum bug ranking to record.

              Since:
              2.4.1

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.nested", defaultValue = "false" ) public java.lang.Boolean nested

              This option enables or disables scanning of nested jar and zip files found in the list of files and directories to be analyzed.

              Since:
              2.3.2

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.omitVisitors" ) public java.lang.String omitVisitors

              The visitor list to omit. This is a comma-delimited list.

              Since:
              1.0-beta-1

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.onlyAnalyze" ) public java.lang.String onlyAnalyze

              Restrict analysis to the given comma-separated list of classes and packages.

              Since:
              1.1

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "${project.reporting.outputDirectory}", required = true ) public java.io.File outputDirectory

              Location where generated html will be created.

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "${project.reporting.outputEncoding}", property="outputEncoding" ) public java.lang.String outputEncoding

              The file encoding to use when creating the HTML reports. If the property project.reporting.outputEncoding is not set, the platform default encoding is used.

              Since:
              2.2

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="plugin.artifacts", required = true, readonly = true ) public java.util.ArrayList pluginArtifacts

              List of artifacts this plugin depends on. Used for resolving the Findbugs coreplugin.

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.pluginList" ) public java.lang.String pluginList

              The plugin list to include in the report. This is a comma-delimited list.

              Potential values are a filesystem path, a URL, or a classpath resource.

              This parameter is resolved as resource, URL, then file. If successfully resolved, the contents of the configuration is copied into the ${project.build.directory} directory before being passed to Findbugs as a plugin file.

              Since:
              1.0-beta-1

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter public PluginArtifact[] plugins

              Collection of PluginArtifact to work on. (PluginArtifact contains groupId, artifactId, version, type.) See Usage for details.

              Since:
              2.4.1

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="project", required = true, readonly = true ) public org.apache.maven.project.MavenProject project

              Maven Project

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "false", property="findbugs.relaxed" ) public java.lang.Boolean relaxed

              Relaxed reporting mode. For many detectors, this option suppresses the heuristics used to avoid reporting false positives.

              Since:
              1.1

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="project.remoteArtifactRepositories", required = true, readonly = true ) public java.util.List remoteArtifactRepositories

              Remote repositories which will be searched for the coreplugin jar.

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="project.remoteArtifactRepositories", required = true, readonly = true ) public java.util.List remoteRepositories

              List of Remote Repositories used by the resolver

              Since:

              component:

              Since:

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.skip", defaultValue = "false" ) public boolean skip

              Skip entire check.

              Since:
              1.1

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "${project.build.sourceEncoding}", property="encoding" ) public java.lang.String sourceEncoding

              The file encoding to use when reading the source files. If the property project.build.sourceEncoding is not set, the platform default encoding is used.

              Since:
              2.2

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "${project.build.testOutputDirectory}", required = true ) public java.io.File testClassFilesDirectory

              Directory containing the test class files for FindBugs to analyze.

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "${project.testCompileSourceRoots}", required = true, readonly = true ) public java.util.List testSourceRoots

              The directories containing the test-sources to be compiled.

              Since:
              2.0

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "Default", property="findbugs.threshold" ) public java.lang.String threshold

              Threshold of minimum bug severity to report. Valid values are High, Default, Low, Ignore, and Exp (for experimental).

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.timeout", defaultValue = "600000" ) public int timeout

              Specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that FindBugs may run before it is assumed to be hung and is terminated. The default is 600,000 milliseconds, which is ten minutes. This only works if the fork parameter is set true.

              Since:
              2.2

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.trace", defaultValue = "false" ) public java.lang.Boolean trace

              Prints a trace of detectors run and classes analyzed to standard output. Useful for troubleshooting unexpected analysis failures.

              Since:
              2.3.2

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( property="findbugs.visitors" ) public java.lang.String visitors

              The visitor list to run. This is a comma-delimited list.

              Since:
              1.0-beta-1

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "UTF-8", readonly = true ) public java.lang.String xmlEncoding

              Encoding used for xml files. Default value is UTF-8.

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "false", property="findbugs.xmlOutput", required = true ) public boolean xmlOutput

              Turn on and off xml output of the Findbugs report.

              Since:
              1.0.0

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "${project.build.directory}", required = true ) public java.io.File xmlOutputDirectory

              Specifies the directory where the xml output will be generated.

              Since:
              1.0.0

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "${project.reporting.outputDirectory}/xref" ) public java.io.File xrefLocation

              Location of the Xrefs to link to.

            • @org.apache.maven.plugins.annotations.Parameter( defaultValue = "${project.reporting.outputDirectory}/xref-test" ) public java.io.File xrefTestLocation

              Location of the Test Xrefs to link to.

            • @java.lang.Override protected java.lang.String getOutputDirectory()

              Returns the report output directory. Called by AbstractMavenReport.execute() for creating the sink.

              Returns:
